newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MSCI says mulls central European futures products.
newsitem.headline: MSCI says mulls central European futures products.

text.p: Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) said on Monday it would launch futures products on its central European stock indices once it has moved them to real time from the current daily calculations.

"It is something which we are definitely looking at," Morgan Stanley Co International Ltd's vice president Jane A Staunton told Reuters, adding that she could not yet say when MSCI would implement such products.
Central Europe's developing share markets are all currently moving towards real time stock index calculations, with Prague, Warsaw and Budapest taking the lead.
MSCI began calculating its index for Polish shares in 1995, and added Hungary and the Czech Republic in September this year in response to customer demand, Staunton said.
She added that MSCI would launch its Russia index on December 1.
The MSCI indices are used by fund managers to allocate assets and to track performance.
